alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 8:49AM EST until February 07 at 2:20AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Sunday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed French Broad River Blantyre 16.0 16.7 Sun 8 am EST 12.7 9.1 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this evening before 900 PM EST.
